intro: Erycibe stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf erycibe, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, smooth seeds. Erycibe stenophylla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
